title: Senior Product Manager
required_qualifications_text:
: Bachelor's Degree AND 5+ years experience in product/service/program management or software development OR equivalent experience. Experience with hardware and software-based solutions with a focus on product fundamentals, such as performance, telemetry, and diagnostics. Preferred/Additional Qualifications : Demonstrated knowledge or hands-on experience applying AI technologies to enhance endpoint management, including areas such as predictive analytics, automated remediation, and/or intelligent policy enforcement. The ability to communicate clearly and effectively with diverse audiences, including through all levels of an organization, technical and non-technical. Experience working on an initiative through a full product lifecycle. 5+ years of collaboration and relationship management skills for making change happen in a highly matrixed environment. Product Management IC4 - The typical base pay range for this role across the U.S. is USD $119,800 - $234,700 per year. There is a different range applicable to specific work locations, within the San Francisco Bay area and New York City metropolitan area, and the base pay range for this role in those locations is USD $158,400 - $258,000 per year. Certain roles may be eligible for benefits and other compensation. Find additional benefits and pay information here: https://careers.microsoft.com/us/en/us-corporate-pay Microsoft will accept applications and processes offers for these roles on an ongoing basis. #W+DJOBS

• Bachelor's Degree AND 5+ years experience in product/service/program management or software development OR equivalent experience.
• Experience with hardware and software-based solutions with a focus on product fundamentals, such as performance, telemetry, and diagnostics.
• OR equivalent experience.
Preferred/Additional Qualifications :
• Demonstrated knowledge or hands-on experience applying AI technologies to enhance endpoint management, including areas such as predictive analytics, automated remediation, and/or intelligent policy enforcement.
• The ability to communicate clearly and effectively with diverse audiences, including through all levels of an organization, technical and non-technical.
• Experience working on an initiative through a full product lifecycle.
• 5+ years of collaboration and relationship management skills for making change happen in a highly matrixed environment.
Demonstrated knowledge or hands-on experience applying AI technologies to enhance endpoint management, including areas such as predictive analytics, automated remediation, and/or intelligent policy enforcement.
Product Management IC4 - The typical base pay range for this role across the U.S. is USD $119,800 - $234,700 per year. There is a different range applicable to specific work locations, within the San Francisco Bay area and New York City metropolitan area, and the base pay range for this role in those locations is USD $158,400 - $258,000 per year.
Certain roles may be eligible for benefits and other compensation. Find additional benefits and pay information here: https://careers.microsoft.com/us/en/us-corporate-pay
